intro: Pedilanthus olsson-sefferi, commonly known as the Olsson-Sefferi's candleplant, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. This species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
